questions.question_text: Which of the following devices allows administrators to prioritize network traffic based on the protocol type?

discussion.content: Managed Switches provide all the features of an Unmanaged Switch, but also provide the ability to configure, manage, and monitor your LAN. Furthermore, a Managed Switch gives you more control over your LAN traffic and offers advanced features to control that traffic.

questions.question_text: The touch-screen feature on a Windows device has stopped working completely. Which of the following should a technician check FIRST?

discussion.content: It's been a rough ride but we made it to the end guys! I wish you all the best of luck on your exam. I am sure you all will do great :D
I think A. Device Manager. you check the driver of the touch screan
Why does the correct answer say C but 100% of the community says A ????

Selected Answer: A
A. Device Manager
i will run this like 3x before i right my exams

The touch-screen feature on a Windows device has stopped working.
Which of the following should the technician check FIRST?
A. Device Manager
B. Performance Monitor
C. System configuration
D. Digitizer settings
Suggested Answer: D 
ABOVE WAS COMTIAS ANSWER A YEAR AGO.

This is the same as question 65 with just the last answer, the correct one, changed to Sync Center. I'm abit confused how it can be right here, but it wasn't right there?

https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/comptia/view/9727-exam-220-1001-topic-1-question-65-discussion/

comments.content: Ok I can now see the difference between them is the addition of the word "completely". I'm guessing that changes where you'd check then.

discussion.content: System Configuration MSConfig is a system utility designed to troubleshoot the Microsoft Windows startup process. Correct answer is A.

questions.question_text:
A company has very strict rules regarding proprietary information leaving the premises. All computers host proprietary information. A technician is called to repair a computer on-site at the company's corporate office. The technician identifies the problem and goes through the troubleshooting steps to create a plan of action.
The technician determines the computer needs to be taken off-site for repair.
Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

discussion.content: Never assume. Do not assume that it is ok to remove the HDD and especially do not assume it is ok to delete any data. Also, do not assume the manager has the authorization to make that decision. The next step you should take is to check the corporate policies to make sure that you are working within accordance to the policies laid by the company.
Jesus. it has already being told that the company has strict rules why does the technician has to check the companies policies?

comments.content: There can always be more to what is told.

discussion.content: But even if he checks the company policy, he is still going to need authorization from management anyway to take it off site right?
They tell you that they are strict but in the scenario, they don't tell the tecnician anything, that's why he has to check policies because he knows that campanies sometimes have strict rules.

comments.content: Then isn't checking for authorization from manager the quickest way, since they should know the policy?

It's CompTIA exam after all. The real issue is most people want to be feel safe, and secure, however when come to implementing security measures they hate them, because they don't fully understand them.
Sure it does happen in real life. Checking policies would be part of his job anyway.
But does that actually happen in real life Cyber? No, no it does not. On the exam it does.

Read question again, and pay attention: the company has very strong policy regarding electronic devices leaving premise. Therefore a technician should check those policies before even considering removing any internal PC components

discussion.content: Once again, the person who writes these questions should be fired. The course of action is entirely dependent on what repair the computer needs. If it needs a new motherboard then take the hard drive out, take the computer to your place of business, replace the board and bring it back, pop the drive back in and there you go. This is what I'm talking about when it comes to these questions and how ambiguously stupid they are.

choices.D: Remove the HDD and send the device for repair.
choices.C: Delete proprietary data before leaving the building.

questions.question_text: Which of the following ports would allow for the remote management of network devices using community strings? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: SNMP uses the UDP port 161 of the SNMP Agent for sending and receiving requests, and port 162 of the SNMP Manager for receiving traps from managed devices.

An SNMP community string is a means of accessing statistics stored within a router or other device. Sometimes referred to simply as a community string or an SNMP string, it comprises the user credential—ID or password—delivered alongside a GET request. A GET request, as its name suggests, is used to request data from a specific resource and is one of the most commonly utilized HTTP methods.

With the appropriate community string, a device is able to access data stored on other devices. If the community string is incorrect, the device will disregard the GET request. This is why it’s important for the SNMP community string to be correct.
SNMP UDP 61/62 "community strings". The answer is correct.
